title: Daily Tick Inspection and Safe Removal
brief: Prevent tick-borne diseases through daily inspection and proper removal techniques.
steps: Step 1: Inspect entire body thoroughly every day, paying attention to hair, armpits, and groin.
Step 2: Check clothing, bedding, and shelter materials for ticks before use.
Step 3: Remove ticks within 6 hours of attachment to prevent disease transmission.
Step 4: Use tweezers or small tools to grasp tick close to skin surface.
Step 5: Pull straight up with steady pressure - do not twist or jerk.
Step 6: Clean bite area with soap and water or antiseptic after removal.
warnings: Disease transmission typically requires 6+ hours of attachment.
Avoid crushing tick body during removal.
Do not use heat, petroleum jelly, or other folk remedies.
Monitor bite site for rash or symptoms in following days/weeks.
